archimate:Device.name: Digital Signage – Informational Displays (DSID)
archimate:Device.documentation:
Intended Use:
• Hospital entrances, waiting rooms, outpatient clinics, emergency department, cafeteria, hallways, elevators, and administrative areas. • Displaying real-time information, wayfinding, announcements, hospital news, health tips, departmental updates, emergency alerts, and community information. • Specifications:
• Screen Size and Resolution: o Standard: 55 inches (waiting areas, halls, departments) o Resolution: 4K UHD (3840x2160) for sharp text and visuals. • Connectivity Options: o Ethernet (RJ-45) for reliable network connectivity o Integrated Wi-Fi (802.11ac or Wi-Fi 6 (ensure compliance with access points)) o HDMI (minimum 2 ports), USB-A ports for local content loading o Bluetooth 5.0+ for peripheral connection ( audio devices). • Operating System: o Dedicated commercial-grade digital signage OS (Samsung Tizen, LG webOS, Android- based signage solutions) o Secure content management mode (locked-down kiosk mode). • Audio Quality: o Integrated speakers (minimum 10–20W total), suitable for clear voice announcements or informational alerts o Bluetooth audio connectivity. • Input Options: o Remote management via centralized software (no direct public access required) o Touch capability for interactive wayfinding (only selected screens if required). • Mounting or Placement Options: o Standard VESA wall mounts (tilt and swivel) o Mobile stands for flexibility o Ceiling or floor mounting brackets as needed o Secure and anti-theft mounting systems. • Durability Rating: o Commercial-grade screens rated for 24/7 continuous operation o Protective tempered glass screens () o Durable metal or reinforced plastic casing suitable for high-traffic environments. • Power Consumption: o ENERGY STAR certified o Automatic standby/sleep mode to save energy when inactive o Typical power usage: under 150–200W in operation, under 1W standby. • Integration Capabilities: o Centralized content management platform compatibility (e.g., ScreenCloud, Rise Vision, NoviSign, or hospital-specific systems) o Integration with emergency alert systems (automatically switching to emergency messages when triggered) o Compatible with hospital information feeds (real-time scheduling, patient queues, etc.) o API-driven integration capability with EMR/HIS systems.
Recommended Accessories and Protective Equipment:
• Wall mounts (fixed or articulating) • Lockable mounting brackets (security) • Cable management solutions • Protective tempered-glass screens for high-risk locations
